medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the Instruction for Returns.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates, and when relevant, the times related to the whole message, e.g. pick up date, message date. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment to specify currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the instruction for returns message, e.g., a credit note.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow (e.g. credit note) the instruction for returns message.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the current document. This may be used to indicate required document receipt dates, times, or periods.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments providing references and any associated dates related to the current message, e.g. announcement for returns number, invoice, etc.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for providing references related to the whole instruction for returns message.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the instruction to return message and any associated information.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment to allow the identification of locations related to the current party, e.g. the location of the goods for returns.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments for specifying any references relating to the current party.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the current party.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for the current party and if required specifying the communication channel and number.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment specifying the communication channel and number for the specified contact.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying any states, instructions, dates or additional references related to the complete instruction for return message.

medi:segment.name: Physical or logical state
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CDI, A segment to enable return states to be specified.

medi:segment.name: Parties and instruction
medi:segment.medi:documentation: INP, A segment to enable return instructions to be specified.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and or time related to the return state.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments for specifying any references, and if required any dates, related to the and conditions.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the conditions.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole instruction for returns.

medi:segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms used, e.g. INCOTERMS, a code could be used to specify the delivery terms.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the whole instruction for returns.

medi:segment.name: Transport information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods on which instructions for returns are being provided.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport details.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify equipment in which goods will be transported.

medi:segment.name: Equipment details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements associated with the equipment, such as size.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 11: SG14-SG15-SG16-SG18-SG20-SG21 A group of segments providing details of the individual items for which instruction for returns are being provided. There must be at least one occurrence of this group within an instruction for returns.

medi:segment.name: Line item
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LIN, A segment identifying a line item by the line item number and configuration level, and additionally, identifying the product for return. Other product identification numbers, e.g. supplier product number etc., can be specified within the following PIA segment.

medi:segment.name: Additional product id
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification to the product specified in the LIN segment (e.g. Harmonized System number).

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the current line item as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products that cannot be fully identified by an article number.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the current item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date and or time, or period details relating to the current line item only, e.g. collection date.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities, e.g. return quantity.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment to allow the further identification of locations related to the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying any monetary amounts relating to the product, e.g. credit note amount.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the instruction for returns message, e.g., a credit note, for the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the return (e.g. credit note) for the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the document. This may be used to indicate required document receipt dates, times, or periods.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments for specifying any references relating to the current line item only, e.g. invoice number, etc.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments giving information about dangerous goods.

medi:segment.name: Dangerous goods
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify quantity of the given dangerous goods.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment to describe dangerous goods.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments identifying handling instructions relevant to the current line item only.

medi:segment.name: Handling instructions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling and notification of hazardous materials relevant to the current line item only.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information relevant to the handling instructions, in coded or clear form, used when additional handling information is needed. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments identifying packaging, marks and numbers, date and time information about packing for the product for which an instruction for returns is provided.

medi:segment.name: Package
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of the packages/physical units and the physical type of packaging for the current line item.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying markings, labels, and packing numbers.

medi:segment.name: Package identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and or labels used on the package described in the PAC segment.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying date and or time, or period related to the package.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment providing the identity numbers related to the current package.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying any states, instructions, dates or additional references related to the return of the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Physical or logical state
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CDI, A segment to enable return states to be specified.

medi:segment.name: Parties and instruction
medi:segment.medi:documentation: INP, A segment to enable return instructions to be specified.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and or time related to the return state.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments for specifying any references, and if required any dates, related to the states for the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the conditions.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Transport information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport, e.g. place of collection.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to specify equipment related to the transport of the current line item.

medi:segment.name: Equipment details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as weight.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

medi:segment.name: Control total
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.
